clinical_study.brief_title: Perioperative Methadone Use to Decrease Opioid Requirement in Pediatric Spinal Fusion Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Perioperative Methadone Use to Decrease Opioid Requirement in Pediatric Spinal Fusion Patients

brief_summary.textblock:
Acute pain management following major surgical procedures in pediatric patients continues to be a challenge, especially after extensive posterior spine fusions.
Spine surgery is particularly traumatic, initiating pain in both peripheral and central pathways. While the standard management of post-surgical pain involves a multimodal approach, opioids provide the predominant benefit. However, opioid use is associated with many adverse effects, including nausea, constipation, and pruritus. Perioperative methadone may decrease total opioid consumption and adverse effects as well as improve satisfaction with pain management after scoliosis repair.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a double blind comparison, evaluating the benefits of intraoperative methadone in extensive posterior spine fusion surgery for idiopathic scoliosis. Methadone 0.2 mg/kg will be given to the treatment group. Postoperative evaluation for narcotic use, pain control, and adverse effects will be compared to a standard treatment approach used at Children's Hospital of Wisconsin.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Post-operative Pain Score on the verbal numeric pain scale
primary_outcome.description: Scores range from 0 (no pain) - 10 (worst possible pain)

secondary_outcome.measure: Itching as assessed by number of doses of benadryl required post-operatively
secondary_outcome.description: Number of doses benadryl per patient over 3 post-op days

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient satisfaction as assessed by the question "How satisfied were you with your pain management?"
secondary_outcome.description: Responses can range from 0 (very dissatisfied) to 10 (very satisfied)

secondary_outcome.measure: Nausea as assessed by number of doses of ondansetron required post-operatively
secondary_outcome.description: Number of doses ondansetron per patient over 3 post-op days

secondary_outcome.measure: Constipation as assessed by number of days to first bowel movement
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days to first bowel movement will be recorded for each patient

arm_group.description: Patients will receive a total of 0.2mg/kg IV methadone intraoperative (0.1mg / kg preincision and 0.1mg/kg prior to emergence) with a maximum dosing of 20 mg.
Patient will receive normal saline placebo initially, then morphine prior to emergence.

intervention.description: perioperative IV methadone to be given
Both groups will receive morphine via Patient-Controlled Analgesia pump.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 10-17 years
- Idiopathic scoliosis
- Fusion levels of 10 or greater
- English speaking
- American Society of Anesthesiology (ASA) class 1 and 2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current narcotic use / History of substance abuse
- Morphine, hydromorphone or methadone allergies
- Pregnancy
- Seizure Disorders
- Bleeding disorders
- Non-English speaking
